cellularAutomata.util.math
Class LeastSquaresFit

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.util.math.LeastSquaresFit

public class LeastSquaresFit
extends java.lang.Object

Finds a linear least squares fit to data. The solution has the form mx+b.

Author:
David Bahr

public LeastSquaresFit()
Method Detail

fit

public void fit(java.util.List listOfPoints)
Finds a least squares fit to the supplied data points.

Parameters:
listOfPoints - The list of points that will be fitted with a least squares. The elements of the list must be objects of type Point2D.Double.

fit

public void fit(java.awt.geom.Point2D[] points)
Finds a least squares fit to the supplied data points. this uses the equations as outlined in Numerical Recipes, but the code has been specially adapted for my purposes.

Parameters:
points - The array of points that will be fitted with a least squares.

getChiSquared

public double getChiSquared()
Gets the goodness of fit estimate. Will be 0.0 until the fit method is run.

Returns:
the chiSquared

getRSquared

public double getRSquared()
Gets the linear correlation coefficient. Will be 0.0 until the fit method is run.

Returns:
the rSquared

getSlope

public double getSlope()
Gets the slope of the linear fit. In other words this is "m" in y = mx+b. Will be 0.0 until the fit method is run.

Returns:
the slope

getStandardDeviationSlope

public double getStandardDeviationSlope()
Gets the standard deviation of the slope of the linear fit. Will be 0.0 until the fit method is run.

Returns:
the standardDeviationSlope

getStandardDeviationYIntercept

public double getStandardDeviationYIntercept()
Gets the standard deviation of the y-intercept of the linear fit. Will be 0.0 until the fit method is run.

Returns:
the standardDeviationYIntercept

getYIntercept

public double getYIntercept()
Gets the y-intercept of the linear fit. In other words this is "b" in y = mx+b. Will be 0.0 until the fit method is run.

Returns:
the yIntercept
